pages.title: Page 1: Welcome to the World of AI Engineers
pages.content:
Mentor Opening

Say with energy: “Welcome to Day 1 — where you stop being a regular developer and start thinking like an AI Engineer.”

Explain that an AI Engineer is someone who doesn’t write every line of code manually — instead, they orchestrate AI tools to build software 10x faster.

Key Idea

  • Traditional developers write syntax; AI Engineers write instructions.
  • They use AI copilots, design generators, and assistants to build complete systems.
  • Their focus is no longer ‘how to code’, but ‘what to build and why.’

Class Discussion

Ask students: “If AI can write code, what’s your job now?” Let them brainstorm. Then reveal:

Answer: Your job is to direct AI clearly — to guide it, refine its output, and ship the final product.

Activity

Have everyone write one line in their notebook: “I am not replacing coding — I’m multiplying it.”

Say: “That’s your new identity as an AI Engineer.”

pages.title: Page 2: Understanding the AI-Accelerated SDLC
pages.content:
Mentor Overview

Say: “Every software project follows a lifecycle — from idea to deployment. Let’s see how AI changes each step.”

The Traditional SDLC

  1. Requirements gathering (slow meetings, documents)
  2. Design (manual wireframes)
  3. Development (writing thousands of lines manually)
  4. Testing (manual debugging)
  5. Deployment (scripts, setup)

The AI-Powered SDLC

  • ChatGPT generates product ideas and PRDs.
  • V0 creates UI layouts in minutes.
  • Cursor writes and refactors your code in your IDE.
  • Claude explains, optimizes, and debugs large files.
  • Vercel/Railway deploy projects instantly.

Mentor Quote

“What took 3 months before, now takes 3 days. The AI Engineer isn’t faster — they’re amplified.”

Student Task

Ask them to draw a quick 5-step flow in their notes: Idea → Design → Build → Test → Deploy, and note which AI tool fits where.

Key Outcome: Understand how AI integrates into every stage of the software lifecycle.

pages.title: Page 3: AI Tools Overview — Your New Toolkit
pages.content:
Mentor Introduction

Say: “Let’s meet your new teammates — not people, but tools.”

The AI Engineer’s Toolkit

ToolPurposeSDLC Phase
ChatGPTIdea generation, PRDs, writing docsPlan
ClaudeDebugging, analysis, long-context reasoningTest
CursorAI-powered coding inside IDEBuild
V0AI UI generator for ReactDesign
GitHub + LinkedInPortfolio & career presenceDeploy / Showcase

Mentor Demo

Show Cursor AI in action: type a comment // create a login component and watch AI generate the code.

Student Reflection

Ask: “Which of these tools do you think will save you the most time?”

Tip: By the end of this week, students will have used every tool in this table.

pages.title: Page 4: Setting Up Cursor IDE
pages.content:
Mentor Setup

Say: “Now it’s time to set up your AI workspace — Cursor IDE.”

Setup Steps

  1. Go to cursor.sh and download Cursor.
  2. Install and open it.
  3. Sign in with your GitHub account.
  4. In settings, enable:
    - AI Autocomplete
    - Inline Chat
    - Context Awareness

Test the Setup

// Type this in a new file:
// Create a function that checks if a number is prime

function isPrime(n) {
if (n < 2) return false;
for (let i = 2; i <= Math.sqrt(n); i++) {
if (n % i === 0) return false;
}
return true;
}

If Cursor autocompletes your function — you’re ready!

Deliverable: Working Cursor IDE installed and verified.

pages.title: Page 5: Setting Up GitHub and LinkedIn Profiles
pages.content:
Mentor Setup

Say: “We build in public. GitHub shows your code; LinkedIn shows your growth.”

GitHub

  1. Sign up at github.com.
  2. Set profile photo + bio: Aspiring AI Engineer | Building 10x faster with AI tools.
  3. Create your first repo: day1-hello-ai-engineer.

LinkedIn

  1. Update headline: “AI Engineer in Training | Building with ChatGPT, Cursor & V0.”
  2. Write your About section using this prompt:
Write a short LinkedIn about section for an aspiring AI Engineer who loves learning by building with ChatGPT and Cursor. Keep it confident and human.

Review AI output together and let them refine it.

Deliverable: GitHub + LinkedIn profiles complete.

pages.title: Page 6: Generate Your First Project
pages.content:
Mentor Task

Say: “Time to build your very first project — entirely with AI.”

Prompt to Use in ChatGPT

Create a complete Next.js 14 app called 'Hello AI Engineer'.
- Animated gradient background
- Heading: 'Hello AI Engineer'
- Subheading: 'Building 10x faster with AI'
- Button: 'Generate Quote' (shows random AI quote)
- Tailwind CSS + TypeScript + Responsive

Steps

  1. Copy AI output into your folder day1-hello-ai-engineer.
  2. Run npm install → npm run dev.
  3. View your app at localhost:3000.

Mentor Tip

Show them how to tweak prompts: “Add a fade-in animation” → “Make it gradient purple to blue.”

Deliverable: Functional app running locally.

pages.title: Page 7: Test & Debug with AI
pages.content:
Mentor Lesson

Say: “Even AI-generated code breaks sometimes. The skill is knowing how to debug with AI.”

Common Issues

  • ❌ Styles not applying → check Tailwind config
  • ❌ App crashes → missing import
  • ❌ Quotes not randomizing → wrong array index

Debug Prompt Example

My Next.js app crashes on load with error: Cannot read properties of undefined. Here’s my code: [paste]. What’s wrong and how do I fix it?

AI should reply with detailed explanation — walk them through one example fix.

Student Exercise

Introduce 1 small bug intentionally, fix it using ChatGPT or Cursor.

Deliverable: Debugged app that runs perfectly.

pages.title: Page 8: Push to GitHub
pages.content:
Mentor Setup

Say: “Let’s put your first project live on GitHub — your public coding identity.”

Commands

git init
git add .
git commit -m "feat: first AI Engineer project"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/yourname/day1-hello-ai-engineer.git
git push -u origin main

Confirm students can view their project online.

Mentor Tip

Remind: “You don’t need perfection — you need visibility.”

Deliverable: Code live on GitHub with README.md

pages.title: Page 9: Share Your First LinkedIn Post
pages.content:
Mentor Closing

Say with pride: “You’re now officially in public. Let’s tell the world.”

Post Template

🚀 Day 1 of my AI Engineer journey

✅ Installed Cursor IDE
✅ Built first app with ChatGPT
✅ Pushed project to GitHub

Learning: AI doesn't replace coding — it amplifies it.

Check my project 👇
🔗 GitHub: [link]
#AIEngineering #WebDevelopment #LearnInPublic

Activity

  1. Each student posts their project using the template.
  2. Tag their classmates and the mentor.

Celebrate with a few claps or a selfie moment 🎉

Deliverable: LinkedIn post shared publicly with project link.
